goals.question: What is the overall trend of unemployment rate across all industries?
goals.visualization: Line chart of unemployment rate over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if the unemployment rate has been increasing or decreasing over time and if there are any patterns or seasonality in the data.

goals.question: Which industry has the highest unemployment rate?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of unemployment rate by industry
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the industry with the highest unemployment rate and compare it to other industries.

goals.question: What is the distribution of unemployment count across all industries?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of unemployment count across all industries and identify any outliers.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between unemployment count and unemployment rate?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of unemployment count vs unemployment rate
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify if there is a correlation between unemployment count and unemployment rate and if the correlation is positive or negative.

goals.question: What is the average unemployment rate by year?
goals.visualization: Line chart of average unemployment rate by year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there are any trends or patterns in the average unemployment rate by year and if the rate has been increasing or decreasing over time.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the overall trend of unemployment rate across all industries?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['date'])
    data = data.sort_values(by='rate', ascending=False)
    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
    chart = sns.barplot(x='series', y='rate', data=data, palette='Blues_d')
    chart.axhline(y=data['rate'].max(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f"Max rate: {data['rate'].max():.2f}")
    chart.set_xticklabels(chart.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, horizontalalignment='right')
    chart.set(xlabel='Industry', ylabel='Unemployment rate')
    chart.legend()
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['count'] = pd.to_numeric(data['count'], errors='coerce')
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='count', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.axvline(data['count'].median(), color='red', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['count'].median()))
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of unemployment count across all industries?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    sns.scatterplot(x='count', y='rate', data=data)
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between unemployment count and unemployment rate?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
    data = data.groupby('year')['rate'].mean().reset_index()
    chart = sns.lineplot(x='year', y='rate', data=data)
    chart.axhline(y=data['rate'].median(), color='r', linestyle='--', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['rate'].median()))
    chart.legend()
    plt.title('What is the average unemployment rate by year?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

chart.code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
    data = data.groupby('year')['rate'].mean().reset_index()
    chart = sns.lineplot(x='year', y='rate', data=data)
    chart.axhline(y=data['rate'].median(), color='r', linestyle='--', label='Median: {:.2f}'.format(data['rate'].median()))
    chart.legend()
    plt.title('What is the average unemployment rate by year?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)
